Articles.Content:
Occasionally, I try to access a page on these forums and I get a 502 bad gateway error.

Does anyone know the cause?
502's occur due to a server between yourself and the KSP forums not responding, there's nothing we can do about it, sorry.

Ok, so after noticing growing and subsiding levels of 502 errors, for myself and others, I have decided to make a list of these occurances... So here is a list...

If you would like to add to this list, then please fill the form below...

Edited July 11, 2014 by ZooNamedGames

Uh oh, I hope we don't have another forumsplotion! That would be catastrophic!

It's been happening to me too.

Uh oh, I hope we don't have another forumsplotion! That would be catastrophic!

It's been happening to me too.

I had one in attempting to reload this very page... So I feel a forum break down might be likely...

It's like a game I've played, whenever you get low frame rates, the game is likely to crash.
We need to inform the devs, fast!

We need to inform the devs, fast!

Hence why I'm making this... If I don't get a mod by 12:00pm tomorrow, I'll pm one and draw em here.

Hence why I'm making this... If I don't get a mod by 12:00pm tomorrow, I'll pm one and draw em here.

The fate of the forums rest in our hands!

Rest assured that we of the forum staff have taken notice of this ourselves. Hopefully today's little string of off-and-on Bad Gateway errors was just a "hiccup," but if it starts becoming a consistent pattern, we'll have the more tech-savvy among us investigate it

EDIT: And it seems one of us already has. Seems to be a server-side issue, unfortunately, but again, if it does seriously impair forum usage in the future, we'll make sure it's dealt with.

Edited July 4, 2014 by Specialist290
Ok, good.

Rest assured that we of the forum staff have taken notice of this ourselves. Hopefully today's little string of off-and-on Bad Gateway errors was just a "hiccup," but if it starts becoming a consistent pattern, we'll have the more tech-savvy among us investigate it

EDIT: And it seems one of us already has. Seems to be a server-side issue, unfortunately, but again, if it does seriously impair forum usage in the future, we'll make sure it's dealt with.

Alright. I did notice that thread prior to making this, but I wanted to ask if there isn anything I can do from my end. Because the last thing I want is another forum Derp.

Alright. I did notice that thread prior to making this, but I wanted to ask if there isn anything I can do from my end. Because the last thing I want is another forum Derp.

Thankfully, SQUAD has been much more diligent about backing up their forum data since then, so it's unlikely we'd lose months' worth of posts like that again. However, unexpected forum downtime is something we want to avoid as much as possible in any case, so we'll be keeping an eye out.

I would like to add to the list of people experiencing this. However it wasn't just the past two days. I've been getting them for over a week. Just a refresh or two fixes it so it's not a real problem right now. Will inform you guys if it gets worse randomly for me.

Yes, I have been getting 502s for a few days now. I think it is to do with the servers acting up. As data is backed up on a regular basis, if we do have a "Forumsplosion", it will only set the forums back by a day or so.

Yes, I have been getting 502s for a few days now. I think it is to do with the servers acting up. As data is backed up on a regular basis, if we do have a "Forumsplosion", it will only set the forums back by a day or so.

Alright, but if there is something I can do, then let me know.
12:56pm EST, yet another 502.... I'm keeping a log from now on.... Sticky this thread if you find that feature valuable.

Multiplay (the host network) has been doing maintenance lately, and apparently today has been a very busy day on the forums which has caused some errors as well. Long story short: they're working on it!

There's been a massive jump this week. It took me 5 tries from several angles just to get in here. I hope this isn't Forum massacre mkII.

Edited July 4, 2014 by Spartwo

502 Bad Gateway

The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server.

You're going through a proxy which seems to be having issues talking to the webserver hosting the KSP forums.

Ironically, I'm encountering the same thing trying to post this reply ><

I suggest that if The Second Great Forumsplotion occurs, you should make a back up right now. EDIT: You already do, oops.

I'm getting a lot of 502's, and the forum functions seem to break down and glitch after these occur. Then they repair themselves. It's weird.

I suggest that if The Second Great Forumsplotion occurs, you should make a back up right now. EDIT: You already do, oops.

I'm getting a lot of 502's, and the forum functions seem to break down and glitch after these occur. Then they repair themselves. It's weird.

The errors are caused by the server maxing out its CPU, and then some. The cause is currently not known. Normally the server uses <5% CPU

I'm getting a lot of 502's, and the forum functions seem to break down and glitch after these occur. Then they repair themselves. It's weird.

It seems less weird to me. A proxy is intended to cache information in order to reduce the load on the main webserver. If communications go down between the proxy and the webserver, the proxy will generally continue to serve it's local copy to requests, until the cache is old enough to be deemed invalid. At this time, if the communication is still down, you'll encounter an error.

So ultimately, this kind of up-down-up behaviour we're seeing at the front-end seems normal enough, knowing that there is an issue at the back end.

(And to whoever is trying to fix it, good luck, these things often have an ETA analogous to the length of a piece of string.)

The errors are caused by the server maxing out its CPU, and then some. The cause is currently not known. Normally the server uses <5% CPU

Bit confused here. From the other thread:

"502's occur due to a server between yourself and the KSP forums not responding, there's nothing we can do about it, sorry."

Just seems odd that I only hit a problematic server on the way to the KSP forums. Do you mean a server used by your server host or not? My brain hurts.
I've had this happen a lot. Something about bad gateways.

I've had other scary issues too... Like where the >> symbols by the recent posts turn into houses!! It was weird... I've got a lot of stories!

Also, 4:02pm. 502.
